description: Implement GitHub Projects v2 storage engine
context:
Create storage backend that uses GitHub Projects v2 as task storage.

Requirements:
- Implement StorageEngine interface
- Use GitHub GraphQL API
- Map dex tasks to project items (draft issues)
- Support custom fields for metadata
- Handle 2-step workflow (create then update)

Mapping:
- id → projectItem.id
- description → draft issue title
- context → draft issue body
- result → custom field: Result (text)
- status → status field (pending/completed columns)
- priority → custom field: Priority (number)
- parent_id → custom field: Parent ID (text)
- completed_at → custom field: Completed (date)
- timestamps → projectItem created/updated

Implementation approach:
1. Add @octokit/graphql dependency
2. Create src/core/github-projects-storage.ts
3. Implement read() - query project items, parse to TaskStore
4. Implement write() - use addProjectV2DraftIssue + updateProjectV2ItemFieldValue
5. Handle field ID resolution (cache field IDs)
6. Support both project_number and project_id config
7. Handle 2-step workflow (create, then update fields)

Done when:
- GitHubProjectsStorage class implements StorageEngine
- Can create/read/update/delete tasks via Projects v2
- Field mappings configurable in config
- Authentication works with token (project scope)
- Handles field ID lookups efficiently
- Unit tests with mocked GraphQL
- Documentation on project setup (must pre-configure fields)

Related: GitHub Projects v2 GraphQL API, custom fields
Config: [storage.github-projects] owner, project_number, token_env, field_names

Note: Status columns cannot be created via API - must be pre-configured in project
